results.title: The Action of the clinical thermometer
results.brief_description: This film shows the non-continuous movement of mercury past the restriction in the glass tube of a clinical thermometer. An example of the use of cinematography in scientific research, this film is the first case in which cinematography through a microscope has been combined with high-speed cinematography at 3000 frames per second.
results.description: This film shows the non-continuous movement of mercury past the restriction in the glass tube of a clinical thermometer. results.title: The Accursed architect
results.creator_credit: La Societe Nouvelle Pathe-Cinema and Pierre Cast
results.brief_description: An investigation of the work and theories of Claude-Nicolas Ledoux, 1736-1806, an architect and innovator two centuries before his time. Initially he created chateaux for the French nobility, but later he became an urbanist, designing houses and cities for the working man. However, his utopian dream that architecture should be related to daily life was not realised.

results.title: The Accessible Arctic
results.brief_description: Convincing evidence of the growing advance of industry and settlement in the Canadian far north. New roads, railways and airfields have brought the once isolated northern communities into the mainstream of Canadian life and progress. Explains how this is being done and shows some of the people who are doing it. Among these are Indian and Eskimo graduates of the new trade schools.

results.title: The Abode of peace
results.creator_credit: B.H. Hipkins, Malayan Film Unit and Ow Kheng Law
results.brief_description: The British Protected Sultanate of Brunei lies on the northern coastline of the island of Borneo, between North Borneo and Sarawak. This film is an account of Brunei’s struggle to preserve the best of an old civilisation while using the new prosperity brought by the discovery of oil in the territory to build roads, schools and hospitals.

results.title: The ABC of unions
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Film Corporation and Barry Pierce
results.brief_description: A group of high school students, reacting against their harsh music master, devise an analogous story about why there are trade unions. They learn all about arbitration, bargaining and compromise. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: The ABC of puppets
results.creator_credit: Portia Hawley and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: A film in two parts. Part 1 illustrates the processes of making a glove puppet in detail. Part 2 shows the construction of a stage for the puppets and their manipulation. The story of Hansel and Gretel is performed.

results.title: The ABC of It
results.creator_credit: Brian Adams, ABC-TV (Australia) and Stafford Garner
results.brief_description: An impressionistic look at the many aspects of the Australian Broadcasting Commission, showing film crews on location and in the studio; collation and broadcasting of daily news; events; ethnic radio; orchestral performances; sporting events coverage; and rating surveys.

results.title: The ABC's of film direction
results.brief_description: Demonstrates techniques and devices of film production used to create different effects on the screen. Describes types of camera movement, subject movement and lens choice to produce desired effects. Discusses dissolves, fades and cutouts as methods to show passage of time.
